title: Philemon 1:1
content: 1 Paul, a prisoner of Christ Jesus, and Timothy our brother, to Philemon, our beloved fellow worker,

title: Philemon 1:2
content: 2 to the beloved Apphia, to Archippus our fellow soldier, and to the assembly in your house:

title: Philemon 1:3
content: 3 Grace to you and peace from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.

title: Philemon 1:4
content: 4 I thank my God always, making mention of you in my prayers,

title: Philemon 1:5
content: 5 hearing of your love and of the faith which you have toward the Lord Jesus and toward all the saints,

title: Philemon 1:6
content: 6 that the fellowship of your faith may become effective in the knowledge of every good thing which is in us in Christ Jesus.

title: Philemon 1:7
content: 7 For we have much joy and comfort in your love, because the hearts of the saints have been refreshed through you, brother.

title: Philemon 1:8
content: 8 Therefore though I have all boldness in Christ to command you that which is appropriate,

title: Philemon 1:9
content: 9 yet for love’s sake I rather appeal to you, being such a one as Paul, the aged, but also a prisoner of Jesus Christ.

title: Philemon 1:10
content: 10 I appeal to you for my child Onesimus, whom I have become the father of in my chains,

title: Philemon 1:11
content: 11 who once was useless to you, but now is useful to you and to me.

title: Philemon 1:12
content: 12 I am sending him back. Therefore receive him, that is, my own heart,

title: Philemon 1:13
content: 13 whom I desired to keep with me, that on your behalf he might serve me in my chains for the Good News.

title: Philemon 1:14
content: 14 But I was willing to do nothing without your consent, that your goodness would not be as of necessity, but of free will.

title: Philemon 1:15
content: 15 For perhaps he was therefore separated from you for a while that you would have him forever,

title: Philemon 1:16
content: 16 no longer as a slave, but more than a slave, a beloved brother—especially to me, but how much rather to you, both in the flesh and in the Lord.

title: Philemon 1:17
content: 17 If then you count me a partner, receive him as you would receive me.

title: Philemon 1:18
content: 18 But if he has wronged you at all or owes you anything, put that to my account.

title: Philemon 1:19
content: 19 I, Paul, write this with my own hand: I will repay it (not to mention to you that you owe to me even your own self besides).

title: Philemon 1:20
content: 20 Yes, brother, let me have joy from you in the Lord. Refresh my heart in the Lord.

title: Philemon 1:21
content: 21 Having confidence in your obedience, I write to you, knowing that you will do even beyond what I say.

title: Philemon 1:22
content: 22 Also, prepare a guest room for me, for I hope that through your prayers I will be restored to you.

title: Philemon 1:23
content: 23 Epaphras, my fellow prisoner in Christ Jesus, greets you,

title: Philemon 1:24
content: 24 as do Mark, Aristarchus, Demas, and Luke, my fellow workers.

title: Philemon 1:25
content: 25 The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with your spirit. Amen.
